column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////For those of you not familiar with what a Lou Malnati's deep dish is like
column2: I'll give the basic run-down. The crust is first set into a deep pan. Not too much crust
column3: just enough. Then a layer of sausage
column5: and then topped with tomato sauce. Simple
column6: but delicious. You wait half an hour after ordering
column7: and then it comes out to you
column9: with a crisp almost crumbly crust. The buttercrust at Malnati's is hands down the best crust of any other deep dish spot. Fork and knife necessary
column10: load up on hot pepper and cheese if you would like
